channel.title: go-stdlib on Michael Thornton
channel.description: Recent content in go-stdlib on Michael Thornton

item.title: Reading the Go Standard Library - net/http
item.description: A piece of advice I often see when learning a new language is to read the standard library. So I’m taking a tour through go’s stdlib in order to get a more comprehensive understanding of the library. I’ve always liked the site Learn X in Y Minutes, and decided as I went through this to write out functions and code in a similar manner. The blog post has split out the comments into Markdown, but if you just wish to see the code, you can do so on github.
